page.title: 03SOCIAL CHANGES,HASELOR WARKS
page.content: I went to my Grandma's house the other day to talk to her about the changes in Haselor. She thinks that the Moody's house is the oldest because it has a Georgian front and Elizabethian back,it was once a little school.She thinks that people are not so friendly as they were because fewer people had cars in earlier days so they looked for friendship and recreation in the village. The only shop she remembers is the post office,she also knows that there were mobile shops, there was an oil man who came on Friday and a greengrocer girl.When we started to talk about the church, she said that it had never changed that she knew of. She also said that the post office has moved from Ide cottage to its present position.
